Samson Agonistes, the 'dramatic poem' by John Milton, was published in 1671, 
three years before the poet's death. Written in the form of a Greek tragedy, with 
the Chorus commenting on the action, it follows the biblical story of the blind 
Samson as he wreaks his revenge on the Philistines who have imprisoned him.
